reviews.text: This hotel is brand new in the pedestrian area of Haarlem. If you have a car it can be hard to find but it is walking distance from the railway station. Haarlem is only 20 minutes away from Amsterdam by train and the hotels are cheaper so it makes it a good alternative. After visiting Amsterdam we were happy to go back to Haarlem which offers a similar feel without all the traffic. We got a good deal on the hotel's website and made a last minute reservation. My only problem with the hotel is that the pillows are too hard but you can request softer ones at the reception, something I wish I had known ahead of time. There is a computer and a printer in the lobby and the internet connection is free of charge which is certainly a plus. There are safes in the rooms and water dispensers on every floor. We didn't try the breakfast there because of the cost, $18 per person. Overall we were very happy with our stay.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in Haarlem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our stay at this hotel, Nice new clean rooms. King was two twins pushed together. Water dispenser on each floor you can help yourself. Very nice new washrooms. Staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Free computer to use in lobby. Excellent location in Haarlem. It is about a ten minute walk to train station and 15 minute train ride to Amsterdam. Shuttle bus from airport takes you to Haarlem bus stop about a 5 minute walk from hotel. Booked through best western's website and received room for 99euro for one night which we felt was a steal for this property.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: I was a little worried about staying here after reading the other two reviews. But it is now virtually finished. The hotel itself certainly is, though I think they may be building a restaurant at the side ... however this doesn't cause any problems.
reviews.title: No longer a building site

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's not the easiest place to find - as you can see from the photo, it blends into the background. Best thing to do if walking from the station (as I was - about 10/15 minutes) is head for the large grey spire you can see from almost everywhere, then ask as it's tucked round one side of the Grote Kirche.
reviews.title: Hotel not ready untill spring 2007

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are very pleasant, bi/tri-lingual and go out of their way to be helpful. The rooms are large ... both myself & my friend had booked single rooms but were both given twin rooms. The bathroom, too, is large with a bath as well as a shower; the only weird thing was the glass door & no lock to the bathroom.
reviews.title: grand construction area AVOID TILL SPRING
